definition: to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: In a country in which many people are illiterate, this is time-consuming.
sentences.chinese: 在一个大部分公民是文盲的国家，这将是旷日持久的。

sentences.english: This long-drawn-out war brought their country's finance to the verge of bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 这场旷日持久的战争使他们国家财政濒于破产的边缘。

sentences.english: The incessant battles have been destructive to far more than just the exterior of the world.
sentences.chinese: 旷日持久的战斗远不止破坏了这个世界的表面。

sentences.english: Hence, the Codification system is a process which will last for a long time in civil law.
sentences.chinese: 因此，民法的法典化规划将是一个旷日持久的过程。

sentences.english: After a long time negotiations, the restructuring between GAIG and Changfeng Automobile is finally settled.
sentences.chinese: 旷日持久的广汽与长丰汽车重组一事终于尘埃落定。

sentences.english: The epic bipartisan struggle unnerved the whole world.
sentences.chinese: 这场旷日持久的两党之争使全世界都为之担忧。

sentences.english: I seek programmer for some projects or for long-drawn collaboration.
sentences.chinese: 我寻求一些项目或旷日持久的合作程序员。

sentences.english: The French and Vietminh settled in for a long siege.
sentences.chinese: 法国和越南的军队进入了一场旷日持久的围城战。

sentences.english: The fight against AIDS will be a long drawn fight.
sentences.chinese: 与艾滋病的斗争将会是一场旷日持久的拉锯战。

sentences.english: We don’t want to see Europe weakened by a protracted crisis.
sentences.chinese: 我们不希望看到欧洲被旷日持久的危机所削弱。

sentences.english: About 2500 years ago there was a very long war.
sentences.chinese: 大约2500年以前，有一场旷日持久的战争。

sentences.english: The long-lasting meeting failed to reach a consensus.
sentences.chinese: 这个旷日持久的会议最终没能达成一致意见。

definition: ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
